Example of spatial multi-omics data (mouse brain with Parkinson’s disease)

[1]:

import os
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import scanpy as sc
import squidpy as sq
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

import metachat as mc

[2]:

# setting work dictionary
os.chdir("/home/Project/MetaChat_test/mouse_brain")

Data preprocessing

Preprocessing for transcriptomics data

[3]:

adata_RNA = sc.read_h5ad('data/multiomics_mousebrain_parkinson_RNA.h5ad')
adata_RNA

[3]:

AnnData object with n_obs × n_vars = 3011 × 32285
    obs: 'in_tissue', 'array_row', 'array_col'
    var: 'gene_ids', 'feature_types', 'genome'
    uns: 'spatial'
    obsm: 'spatial'

[4]:

adata_RNA.var_names_make_unique()
adata_RNA.raw = adata_RNA
sc.pp.normalize_total(adata_RNA, inplace=True)
sc.pp.log1p(adata_RNA)

[5]:

adata_visual = adata_RNA.copy()
random_seed = 42
sc.pp.highly_variable_genes(adata_visual, min_mean=0.0125, max_mean=10, min_disp=0.2)
adata_visual = adata_visual[:, adata_visual.var.highly_variable]
sc.tl.pca(adata_visual, svd_solver='arpack', random_state=random_seed)
sc.pp.neighbors(adata_visual, n_neighbors=10, n_pcs=40, random_state=random_seed)
sc.tl.umap(adata_visual, random_state=random_seed)
sc.tl.leiden(adata_visual, resolution=1)
sc.pl.spatial(adata_visual, color='leiden')

[6]:

cluster_to_cell_type = {
    '0': 'Striatum dorsal region',
    '1': 'Cerebral cortex',
    '2': 'Striatum ventral region',
    '3': 'Cerebral cortex',
    '4': 'Lateral septal complex',
    '5': 'Fiber tracts',
    '6': 'Cerebral cortex',
    '7': 'Fiber tracts',
    '8': 'Cerebral cortex',
    '9': 'Cerebral cortex',
    '10': 'Striatum dorsal region',
    '11': 'Striatum ventral region',
    '12': 'Ventricular systems',
    '13': 'Cerebral cortex',
}
adata_RNA.obs['tissue_type'] = adata_visual.obs['leiden'].map(cluster_to_cell_type)

[7]:

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (5,5))
sq.pl.spatial_scatter(adata = adata_RNA,
                      color = "tissue_type",
                      ax = ax)
ax.set_box_aspect(1)

Preprocessing for metabolomics data

[8]:

adata_MSI = sc.read_h5ad('data/multiomics_mousebrain_parkinson_MSI.h5ad')
adata_MSI.uns['spatial'] = adata_RNA.uns['spatial']
adata_MSI.obsm['spatial'] = adata_RNA.obsm['spatial']
adata_MSI

[8]:

AnnData object with n_obs × n_vars = 3011 × 3015
    obs: 'orig.ident', 'nCount_RNA', 'nFeature_RNA'
    var: 'features'
    uns: 'spatial'
    obsm: 'spatial'

[9]:

adata_MSI.var_names_make_unique()
adata_RNA.raw = adata_RNA
sc.pp.normalize_total(adata_MSI, inplace=True)

Combine the transcriptomics and metabolomics data

[10]:

from scipy.sparse import hstack
X_combined = hstack([adata_RNA.X, adata_MSI.X])
X_combined = X_combined.tocsr()
var_combined = pd.DataFrame({"features" : np.concatenate((np.array(adata_RNA.var_names),np.array(adata_MSI.var_names)))})
var_combined.index = var_combined["features"]
adata = sc.AnnData(X_combined, obs=adata_RNA.obs, var=var_combined)
adata.obsm = adata_RNA.obsm
adata.uns = adata_RNA.uns

MCC Inference

Import MetaChatDB

[11]:

df_metasen = mc.pp.MetaChatDB(species='mouse')

Identify long-range channels

[12]:

LRC_name = "CSF"
LRC_marker_gene = "Gfap"

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (6,5))
sq.pl.spatial_scatter(adata,
                      color = [LRC_marker_gene],
                      ax = ax)
ax.set_box_aspect(1)
# plt.savefig("figures/" + "LRC_" + LRC_name + "_" + LRC_marker_gene + ".pdf")

[13]:

mc.pp.LRC_unfiltered(adata = adata,
                     LRC_name = LRC_name,
                     LRC_marker_gene = LRC_marker_gene,
                     quantile = 85)

Cells with Gfap expression above the 85% have been selected as candidates and stored in 'adata.obs['LRC_CSF_unfiltered']'.

[14]:

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (6,5))
sq.pl.spatial_scatter(adata,
                      color = 'LRC_' + LRC_name + '_unfiltered',
                      ax = ax)
ax.set_box_aspect(1)
# plt.savefig("figures/" + "LRC_" + LRC_name + "_unfiltered.pdf")

[15]:

# There is a clear long-range channel as CSF vessel, so we perform density peak clustering on points with high marker expression in CSF vessel.
LRC_cluster_CSF = mc.pp.LRC_cluster(adata = adata,
                                    LRC_name = LRC_name,
                                    density_cutoff = 7,
                                    delta_cutoff = 8000,
                                    outlier_cutoff = 4.5)

[16]:

mc.pp.LRC_filtered(adata = adata,
                   LRC_name = LRC_name,
                   LRC_cluster = LRC_cluster_CSF)

Candidate points for CSF LRC are clustered and outliers are removed. LRC points are stored in 'adata.obs['LRC_CSF_filtered']'.

[17]:

import matplotlib.colors as mcolors
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (6,5))
sq.pl.spatial_scatter(adata,
                      color = 'LRC_' + LRC_name + '_filtered',
                      alpha = 1,
                      ax = ax)
ax.set_box_aspect(1)
# plt.savefig("figures/" + "LRC_" + LRC_name + "_filtered.pdf")

[18]:

mc.pp.compute_costDistance(adata = adata,
                           LRC_type = ["CSF"],
                           dis_thr = 1000,
                           k_neighb = 5,
                           LRC_strength = 2000,
                           plot = True)

Compute spatial cost distance without long-range channel...
Compute spatial cost distance incorporating long-range channel of CSF
The points that can occur long-range communication is...

Finished!



[19]:

mc.tl.metabolic_communication(adata = adata,
                              database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                              df_metasen = df_metasen,
                              LRC_type = ["CSF"],
                              dis_thr = 1000)
adata.write('results/inference_results.h5ad')

There are 327 pairs were found from the spatial data.

Downstream analysis

[3]:

adata = sc.read("results/inference_results.h5ad")

Summary communication among different scales

[4]:

sum_metabolites = ['HMDB0000216','HMDB0000073']

[5]:

mc.tl.summary_communication(adata = adata,
                            database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                            sum_metabolites = sum_metabolites)

Identifing MCC flow

[6]:

mc.tl.communication_flow(adata = adata,
                         database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                         sum_metabolites = sum_metabolites,
                         k = 5)

[7]:

fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(15,5))
mc.pl.plot_communication_flow(adata = adata,
                              database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                              metabolite_name = 'HMDB0000073',
                              plot_method = 'grid',
                              background = 'image',
                              group_name = 'tissue_type',
                              summary = 'sender',
                              ndsize = 8,
                              scale = 0.0000000000003,
                              normalize_v_quantile = 0.995,
                              grid_density = 0.4,
                              title = 'Image',
                              ax = ax[0])
ax[0].set_box_aspect(1)

                              database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                              metabolite_name = 'HMDB0000073',
                              plot_method = 'grid',
                              background = 'group',
                              group_name = 'tissue_type',
                              summary = 'sender',
                              ndsize = 8,

ax[1].set_box_aspect(1)

                              database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                              metabolite_name = 'HMDB0000073',
                              plot_method = 'grid',
                              background = 'summary',

Constructing group-level MCC

[8]:

mc.tl.communication_group(adata = adata,
                          database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                          group_name = "tissue_type",
                          sum_metabolites = sum_metabolites,
                          n_permutations = 100)

This is a note.

Correspondingly, the group-level MCC results considering the spatial distance distribution are stored in adata.uns['MetaChat_group_spatial-tissue_type-MetaChatDB-HMDB0000073']

MCC remodelling in receiver cells

[13]:

adata_raw = sc.read_h5ad('data/multiomics_mousebrain_parkinson_RNA.h5ad')

[15]:

metabolite_name = 'HMDB0000073'
df_deg, df_yhat = mc.tl.communication_responseGenes(adata = adata,
                                                    adata_raw = adata_raw,
                                                    database_name = 'MetaChatDB',
                                                    metabolite_name = metabolite_name,
                                                    summary = 'receiver')

[16]:

import pickle
deg_result = {"df_deg": df_deg, "df_yhat": df_yhat}
with open("results/responseGenes_" + metabolite_name + ".pkl", 'wb') as handle:
    pickle.dump(deg_result, handle, protocol=pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)

[15]:

metabolite_name = 'HMDB0000073'
import pickle
with open("results/responseGenes_" + metabolite_name + ".pkl", 'rb') as file:
    deg_result = pickle.load(file)
df_deg = deg_result["df_deg"]
df_yhat = deg_result["df_yhat"]
df_deg_clus, df_yhat_clus = mc.tl.communication_responseGenes_cluster(df_deg.iloc[:,:3], df_yhat, deg_clustering_res=0.2)

[16]:

mc.pl.plot_communication_responseGenes(df_deg = df_deg_clus,
                                       df_yhat = df_yhat_clus,
                                       top_ngene_per_cluster = 8,
                                       colormap = 'viridis',
                                       color_range = (-2,2),
                                       font_scale = 1,
                                       figsize = (10,6),
                                       return_genes = False)

[17]:

df_result = mc.tl.communication_responseGenes_keggEnrich(gene_list = df_deg[df_deg['pvalue'] < 0.05].index.tolist()[:1000],
                                                         gene_sets = "KEGG_2019_Mouse",
                                                         organism = "Mouse")

[18]:

df_result.to_csv("results/responseGenes_keggEnrich_" + metabolite_name + ".csv")

[19]:

mc.pl.plot_communication_responseGenes_keggEnrich(df_result = df_result,
                                                  show_term_order = [1,2,6,7,9],
                                                  cmap = 'blue',
                                                  maxshow_gene = 10,
                                                  figsize = (7,5))

    • Downstream analysis
      • Summary communication among different scales
      • Identifing MCC flow
      • Constructing group-level MCC
      • MCC remodelling in receiver cells
